item.title: MISRA-C friendly C99 static assert macro
item.description: …and a little extra! ⚠️ If you already know what I’m talking about and you just want the macro, you can directly jump to the conclusions. Oftentimes, especially in embedded programming, there are some checks that are better run at compile time rather than at runtime. Let’s say that you have a codebase (for example a library) that has some functionality that relies on the platform’s unsigned int to be exactly 4 bytes, or a long to be exactly 8, or the char type to be signed, and so on.
